geninfo.para: Under some conditions of high humidity, instrument panel gauges may exhibit intermittent or erratic operation. This may be caused by moisture coming in contact with sensitive electronic circuitry on the printed circuit board in the instrument cluster. This condition is evident when the speedometer and tachometer fail to initially operate and then operate normally after the moisture has dissipated. To correct this condition on vehicles built before the date listed above, it will be necessary to remove the circuit board from the instrument cluster and apply a conformal coating to it. All vehicles built after the date listed above have conformal coating added to the instrument cluster printed circuit board.
This letter contains information on how to apply a conformal coating to the instrument cluster printed circuit board on the vehicles listed above.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Main Circuit Board

note.para: Follow these procedures as listed to avoid damage to the instrument cluster.

caution.para: To avoid damage to the printed circuit board, it is recommended that a grounded wrist strap be worn while performing this procedure.

step1.para: Remove the instrument cluster from the vehicle.

note.para: Refer to CTS-5088 in GROUP 08 in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for information on removing the instrument cluster from the vehicle.
Refer to Figure 1 for all Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Place the cluster face down on a clean, soft cloth to prevent damage to the bezel. Remove the six screws (Item 1) that fasten the circuit board shield (Item 2) to the circuit board (Item 3) and remove the shield.
Disconnect the female odometer connector (Item 5, Detail "A") from the male connector (Item 6, Detail "A") on the circuit board.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 2 for all Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Place the instrument cluster face up on a clean, horizontal surface. Remove the three (3) screws (Item 3) that secure the bezel (Item 1) to the instrument cluster housing (Item 2). Take care not to damage the gauges while removing the bezel. Put the bezel in a safe place to prevent scratching.

To remove the gauges, locate the hole in the main circuit board for each gauge. Use a small straight screwdriver to push against the bottom of the gauge to remove it from its pin terminal ( Figure 3).

caution.para: Individual gauge dials are not protected by a lens. When removing gauges, handle them by the edge of the dial face only. Do not touch the gauge pointer.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 4 for all Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove the main circuit board mounting screws (Item 1) and remove the circuit board (Item 2) from the instrument cluster housing (Item 3).
Use a soft bristle brush (tooth brush) and ISOPROPYL ALCOHOL to clean both sides of the circuit board ( Figure 5).
Air pressure is recommended to dry the circuit board. If air pressure is not available, allow the circuit board to dry at room temperature for at least three minutes.
Inspect the circuit board to be sure it is clean and dry.
Cover all electrical contact surfaces such as lamp contacts, air core gauge terminals or pin connectors with masking tape to protect them from the spray sealer.
Spray the printed circuit board with "Gunk" Acra-Seal®, #M4-06 Plastic and Ignition sealer (6 oz. can). Spray lightly until both sides are "wetted"; do not overspray.
After sufficient sealer is applied, allow both sides to dry by leaving exposed at room temperature. Follow the sealer manufacturer's instructions for drying time.
After the sealer is dry, remove all masking tape that was added to protect electrical connectors.

svcsubproc.title: Re-install Main Circuit Board and Shield in Instrument Housing

note.para: Refer to Figure 6 for all Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Handle the circuit board (Item 3) by the edges. Place it on the instrument cluster housing (Item 7), component side up.
Hold the circuit board in position and install the two (2) mounting screws (Item 6).
Connect the female odometer connector (Item 4, Detail "A") onto the male connector (Item 5, Detail "A") on the circuit board.
Position the circuit board shield (Item 2) on the housing locating pins as illustrated in Detail "B." Install the six (6) mounting screws (Item 1) that hold the shield in place.

svcsubproc.title: Re-install Air Core Gauges and Bezel

step1.para: Place the instrument cluster, shield side down on a clean, horizontal surface. Carefully push each gauge into its location on the main circuit board until its pins are completely installed.

caution.para: Individual gauge dials are not protected by a lens. When installing gauges, handle them by the edge of the dial face only. Do not touch the gauge pointer.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 7 for all Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Re-install the bezel (Item 1). Be sure the spring clips (Item 4) on top of the housing (Item 2) are correctly inserted in the spring clip openings (Item 5) on top of the bezel. Secure in place with the three mounting screws (Item 3).
Re-install instrument cluster in vehicle.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to CTS-5088 Master Service Manual for information on installing the instrument cluster.

note.para: Follow these procedures as listed to avoid damage to the instrument cluster.

caution.para: To avoid damage to the printed circuit board, it is recommended that a grounded wrist strap be worn while performing this procedure.

step1.para: Turn ignition key off.
Remove the four screws that hold the center section (tachometer and speedometer) of the instrument panel in place ( Figure 8).
Pull the center section of the instrument panel toward you to expose the two electrical connectors on the back.
Depress the locks and unplug the two electrical connectors. Remove the center section of the instrument panel from the vehicle.

Place the cover plate face down on a soft cloth to prevent damage to the face of the bezel. Remove the six screws on the side of the instrument cluster housing that secure the cover plate to the cluster housing ( Figure 9). Lift the housing off the cover plate.

Carefully pull up with a rocking motion on the speedometer and tachometer gauges until they unplug from the circuit board ( Figure 10). Lay the gauges aside. Take care not to mar the surface of these gauges.

caution.para: Individual gauge dials are not protected by a lens. When removing gauges, handle them by the edge of the dial face only. Do not touch the gauge pointer.

step1.para: Turn the three light sockets (left turn, right turn and high beam) on top of the housing counterclockwise and unplug them from the light housing ( Figure 11).
Unplug the buzzer electrical connector from the circuit board ( Figure 11).
Turn the four instrument illuminating panel lights counterclockwise. Remove the lights and lay aside ( Figure 12).

If the instrument cluster has a digital odometer, remove the three screws that hold the plate on the back of the housing ( Figure 14). If the instrument cluster housing has a mechanical odometer ( Figure 13), unplug the odometer electrical connector from the printed circuit board. If the instrument cluster has a digital odometer, remove the screw in the side of the housing that holds the odometer reset button in place ( Figure 14). Unplug the reset button electrical connector from the printed circuit board and remove the reset button.
Remove the five (5) screws that hold the printed circuit board in place in the housing ( Figure 15).
Carefully remove the circuit board from the housing.
Use a soft bristle brush (tooth brush) and ISOPROPYL ALCOHOL to clean both sides of the circuit board ( Figure 16).
Air pressure is recommended to dry the circuit board. If air pressure is not available, allow the circuit board to dry at room temperature for at least three minutes.
Inspect the circuit board to be sure it is clean and dry on both sides.

Cover all electrical contact surfaces such as lamp contacts, air core gauge terminals or pin connectors with masking tape to protect them from the spray sealer. Be sure the mechanical or digital odometer is covered with tape.
Spray the printed circuit board with "Gunk" Acra-Seal®, #M4-06 Plastic and Ignition sealer (6 oz. can). Spray lightly until both sides are "wetted"; do not overspray.
After sufficient sealer is applied, allow both sides to dry by leaving exposed at room temperature. Follow the sealer manufacturer's instructions for drying time.
After the sealer is dry, remove all masking tape.
Handle the circuit board by the edges and place it in the housing, component side down.
Secure the circuit board in place with five (5) mounting screws ( Figure 15).

If the instrument cluster has a digital odometer, plug the reset button connector into the printed circuit board and mount the reset button to the side of the cluster housing with one screw ( Figure 14).
If the instrument cluster housing has a mechanical odometer, plug the electrical connector into the circuit board ( Figure 17).

Install the left turn, high beam and right turn lights into the light housing by turning them clockwise ( Figure 18). The positions the sockets should be plugged in are printed on the printed circuit board.
Plug the buzzer connector into the printed circuit board ( Figure 18).
Install the plate on the back of the housing with three (3) screws ( Figure 14).
Install the four instrument cluster illuminating panel lights from the back of the housing into the sockets on the printed circuit board by turning them clockwise ( Figure 19).

Install the tachometer and speedometer in the housing circuit board by inserting the pins on the back of the tachometer and speedometer into the socket on the face of the circuit board and carefully push in on them until the pins are pushed completely into the socket ( Figure 20).

caution.para: Individual gauge dials are not protected by a lens. When installing gauges, push down close to the center of the gauge. Do not touch the gauge pointer or mar face of gauge.

step1.para: Place the cover plate face down on a clean, soft cloth. Position the cluster housing on the cover plate and install the six (6) cluster housing mounting screws ( Figure 21).

note.para: The screw with the plastic washer should be installed next to the buzzer housing ( Figure 21).

step1.para: In the vehicle, plug both electrical harnesses into the back of the housing. Care should be taken to plug the connectors into the plug of the same color.
Re-install the center section of the instrument cluster to the instrument panel.
